headline.main: House's Rules Man; Notes on People

results.snippet: The House of Representatives got a new chief adviser on rules and procedures yesterday. He is William H. Brown Jr., a 44-year old lawyer from Huntington, W. Va., who had been an assistant to the former parliamentarian, Lewis Deschler, for 16 years....
results.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives got a new chief adviser on rules and procedures yesterday. He is William H. Brown Jr., a 44-year old lawyer from Huntington, W. Va., who had been an assistant to the former parliamentarian, Lewis Deschler, for 16 years. Senator Edward M. Kennedy waving to Dubliners as he left with his son Edward Jr., for stay in western Ireland.

headline.main: SPACE CREWS HAIL U.S.-SOVIET FLIGHT; Astronauts Report Progress After Training in Russia

results.snippet: The American astronauts of the joint Apollo-Soyuz mission, winding up three weeks of training with Soviet astronauts here, reported today that the crews were progressing well together-and even working in each other's language-since their first...

byline.original: By CHRISTOPER WRENSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: The American astronauts of the joint Apollo-Soyuz mission, winding up three weeks of training with Soviet astronauts here, reported today that the crews were progressing well together-and even working in each other's language-since their first meeting a year ago.

headline.main: Sark Seigneur's Vow; Notes on People

results.snippet: Michael Beaumont, the new Seigneur of Sark, the tiny Island in the English Channel, promised yesterday that he would follow the example of his grandmother during his rule and said that "the last thing. I want to do is drag the island into the 20th...
results.lead_paragraph: Michael Beaumont, the new Seigneur of Sark, the tiny Island in the English Channel, promised yesterday that he would follow the example of his grandmother during his rule and said that "the last thing. I want to do is drag the island into the 20th century."

headline.main: Labor Once Again Key Democratic Fund Source; Party Rules at Issue $1-Million Through May

results.snippet: Organized labor is once again the banker and the backbone of the Democratic campaign for Congress, even a two-year-old fight between the party and leading union politicians threatens to get worse.

results.lead_paragraph: Organized labor is once again the banker and the backbone of the Democratic campaign for Congress, even a two-year-old fight between the party and leading union politicians threatens to get worse.

results.lead_paragraph: Eastern Air Lines, one of the nation's most financially troubled air carriers, and the Braniff International Corporation, parent of Braniff Airways, a much smaller but highly profitable system, both reported yesterday large profits for the second quarter.

results.abstract: Sup Soviet, July 26, approves unanimously and installs Presidium and natl Govt and reappts Roman A Rudenko prosecutor gen; Podgorny renamed Presidium chmn and Kosygin Premier, both proposed by Brezhnev; Yekaterina A Furtseva is retained in post of Culture Min, renamed by Kosygin, to surprise of most pol observers; new Presidium list does not include name of Anastas I Mikoyan, who is 73; among new members is former astronaut Valentina V Nikolayeva-Tereshkova; Sup Soviet ratifies various decrees (M)

headline.main: Top Soviet Officials Renamed to Posts

results.snippet: In just over 22 minutes this afternoon, the newly elected Supreme Soviet, the nominal legislature of the Soviet Union, approved unanimously and installed a Presidium, a national Government and a prosecutor general for the next four years.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: In just over 22 minutes this afternoon, the newly elected Supreme Soviet, the nominal legislature of the Soviet Union, approved unanimously and installed a Presidium, a national Government and a prosecutor general for the next four years.

headline.main: Huffing and Puffing Broadway Through the Summer Doldrums; In the Midst of the Doldrums, Where Are the Orangutans of Yore ?

results.snippet: IN A BURST of old time press-agent stuntsmanship grown rare in recent years, Saul Richman, the jocund, middle-aged publicist responsible for providing "Moonchildren" with full audiences, announced in mid-July that astronaut John Glenn would plant his...
results.lead_paragraph: IN A BURST of old time press-agent stuntsmanship grown rare in recent years, Saul Richman, the jocund, middle-aged publicist responsible for providing "Moonchildren" with full audiences, announced in mid-July that astronaut John Glenn would plant his foot (in a moon boot, of course) in wet cement outside the Theater de Lys last Saturday.
